text:
PROG-RAM
NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTERS
SEPTEMBER 9 & 10-IOWA CITY, IOWA.
River Room of the Iowa Memorial Union.
MONDAY:. SEPTEMBER 9.
9:00 A.M. Registration and visit to WSUI.
;10:00 A.M. Professor Harold G. Ingham, Director of KFKU, Lawrence, Kansas,
presiding.
Address of Welcome - Dr. E. A. Gilmore, President, University
of Iowa, Iowa City, Iowa.
Response and Address - W. I. Griffith, Pres., N.A.E.B., and
Dir. of Radio Station WO I, Ames, Iowa.
Address - "A Radio Introspection" - Harolu A. Engle, promotion
manager of WKA, Madison, Wisconsin.
Address - "A Syndicated Radio Service" - Charles A. Taylor,
Cornell University, Ithaca, New York.
Report of Committee on proposed recorded programs - Chrm.,
T. M. Beaird, Norman, Oklahoma.
NOON RECESS
1:30 P.M. Address ~ "How May The Educational Broadcasting Stations And
The U. S. Office of Education Best Serve Each Other" -
Dr. C. M. Koon, Senior Specialist in Radio & Visual
Education, Washington, D. C.
Address ~ "Are Intercollegiate Radio Debates Justified" -
F. L. Whan, Instr. in Debate, Iowa State College, Ames.
Address - "Ohio’s Junior College of the Air" - R. C. Higgy,
Dir. of Station WOSU, Columbus, Ohio.
Report of Committee on Federal & Educational Program Develop¬
ment - Chrm., Frank E. Schooley, Urbana, Illinois.
Discussion - "Station Radio Problems'
